constructors.doc: Creates a new for applications that can handle content of the given type.
constructors.name: new

doc:
is a widget for selecting applications. It is the main building block for . Most applications only need to use the latter; but you can use this widget as part of a larger widget if you have special needs.

offers detailed control over what applications are shown, using the , , , and properties. See the documentation for more information about these groups of applications.

To keep track of the selected application, use the and signals.

methods.doc: Returns the text that is shown if there are not applications that can handle the content type.
methods.name: get_default_text

methods.doc: Returns the current value of the property.
methods.name: get_show_all

methods.doc: Returns the current value of the property.
methods.name: get_show_default

methods.doc: Returns the current value of the property.
methods.name: get_show_fallback

methods.doc: Returns the current value of the property.
methods.name: get_show_other

methods.doc: Returns the current value of the property.
methods.name: get_show_recommended

methods.doc: Sets the text that is shown if there are not applications that can handle the content type.
methods.name: set_default_text

methods.doc: Sets whether the app chooser should show all applications in a flat list.
methods.name: set_show_all

methods.doc: Sets whether the app chooser should show the default handler for the content type in a separate section.
methods.name: set_show_default

methods.doc: Sets whether the app chooser should show related applications for the content type in a separate section.
methods.name: set_show_fallback

methods.doc: Sets whether the app chooser should show applications which are unrelated to the content type.
methods.name: set_show_other

methods.doc: Sets whether the app chooser should show recommended applications for the content type in a separate section.
methods.name: set_show_recommended

name: AppChooserWidget

properties.doc: The property determines the text that appears in the widget when there are no applications for the given content type. See also .
properties.name: default-text

properties.doc: If the property is true, the app chooser presents all applications in a single list, without subsections for default, recommended or related applications.
properties.name: show-all

properties.doc: The ::show-default property determines whether the app chooser should show the default handler for the content type in a separate section. If false, the default handler is listed among the recommended applications.
properties.name: show-default

properties.doc: The property determines whether the app chooser should show a section for fallback applications. If false, the fallback applications are listed among the other applications.
properties.name: show-fallback

properties.doc: The property determines whether the app chooser should show a section for other applications.
properties.name: show-other

properties.doc: The property determines whether the app chooser should show a section for recommended applications. If false, the recommended applications are listed among the other applications.
properties.name: show-recommended

signals.doc:
Emitted when an application item is activated from the widget's list.

This usually happens when the user double clicks an item, or an item is selected and the user presses one of the keys Space, Shift+Space, Return or Enter.
signals.name: application-activated

signals.doc: Emitted when an application item is selected from the widget's list.
signals.name: application-selected

signals.doc: Emitted when a context menu is about to popup over an application item. Clients can insert menu items into the provided object in the callback of this signal; the context menu will be shown over the item if at least one item has been added to the menu.
signals.name: populate-popup
